images.title: Amsterdam, Ashkenazi synagogue complex
images.description: The Dritt Shul and the Obbene Shul, before they were flanked by an office building of the Jewish Historical Museum. Of the Great Shul, the oldest buidling of the complex (1671), one can see the entrance and the roof, while the Neie Shul is mostly conspicuous because of its light cupola. In the background, across the street (in a more remote past: across the canal), the Portuguese synagogue.
images.creator: Chaim Revier

images.title: View of the Sephardi and Ashkenazi Synagogues in Amsterdam
images.description: View of the Sephardi and Ashkenazi Synagogues in Amsterdam
images.creator: Berckheyde, Gerrit Adriaensz

images.title: Fotoreproductie van een pentekening door J. Sequeira als souvenir ter gelegenheid van het tweede eeuwfeest van de Portugees-Israëlietische Synagoge te Amsterdam, 1875. Souvenir ter gelegenheid van het tweede eeuwfeest der Portugeesch Israëlitische Synagoge te Amsterdam (title on object)
images.description: Photo reproduction of a pen drawing by J. Sequeira. Souvenir on the occasion of the second centenary of the Portuguese-Israelite Synagogue in Amsterdam, 12-15 August 1875. View of the interior of the synagogue with the portraits of Prince William III and King William III at the bottom, the names of the church councilors.
images.creator: Jacques Chits

images.title: Gezicht op de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, ca. 1695. T Profil van de Kerk (title on object)
images.description: View of the Portuguese Synagogue (left of the middle) in Amsterdam, around 1695. Left in the foreground a part of the Lepers house with the legend 1-9. Right part of one of the buildings that served as a synagogue for the High German municipality. Many figures and a carriage on the street and on the bridge. Bottom right a map of the building. A banderole with the title at the top right of the middle.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Inwijding van de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, 1675. La dedicace de la synagogue des Juifs Portugais, a Amsterdam (title on object)
images.description: The festive inauguration of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam on August 2, 1675. On the podium in the middle is the chazan, the cantor, to read from the Torah. In the background the hechal, the cupboard, in which the Torah scrolls are kept. At the bottom of the margin a legend and an explanation in French.
images.creator: Bernard Picart

images.title: Gezicht op de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam
images.description: View of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, with the Deventer Houtmarkt on the right (the current Jonas Daniël Meijerplein). Several figures for the building, including a pickpocket to the left of the tree on the right.
images.creator: anonymous

images.title: Gezicht op de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam. L'Eglise des Juifs / De Portugeese Joode Kerk (title on object)
images.description: View of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, with the Rapenburgerstraat on the left and the Deventer Houtmarkt on the right (the current Jonas Daniël Meijerplein). On it is several figures. Numbered top right: Pag. 160. Under the show the title in Dutch and French.
images.creator: print maker: Daniël Stopendaal

images.title: Gezicht op de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam. Portugeese Joode Kerck (title on object)
images.description: View of the Portuguese Synagogue at the Deventer Houtmarkt, the current Jonas Daniël Meijerplein, in Amsterdam. Different figures on the street.
images.creator: print maker: Romeyn de Hooghe (possibly)

images.title: Gezicht op de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam. Portugeesche Jooden Synagoge (title on object)
images.description: View of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, with the Rapenburgerstraat on the left and the Deventer Houtmarkt on the right (the current Jonas Daniël Meijerplein). On it is several figures.
images.creator: print maker: anonymous; publisher: Nicolaas ten Hoorn (possibly); publisher: erven J. Ratelband & Co (possibly); publisher: Pieter Meyer (possibly)

images.title: Gezicht op de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, ca. 1695. T Profil van de Kerk (title on object)
images.description: View of the Portuguese Synagogue (left of the middle) in Amsterdam, around 1695. Left in the foreground a part of the Lepers house with the legend 1-9. Right part of one of the buildings that served as a synagogue for the High German municipality. Many figures and a carriage on the street and on the bridge. Bottom right a map of the building. A banderole with the title at the top right of the middle.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: De scholen en reinigingsplaatsen bij de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, ca. 1695. De scholen, suyverplaatsen etc. (title on object)
images.description: Visitors to the schools and cleaning places (mikweh) of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, around 1695. In the foreground two men carry a bar through the gate. At the top of the middle a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Interieur van de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam tijdens de inwijding, 1675
images.description: View of the interior of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam during the inauguration on 2 August 1675. In the middle, on the east-facing teba, the chazan. To the right the torah scrolls, worn by men and interspersed by men with a torch or a candle, are carried in a procession to the holy ark (aron hakodoth or hechal). Above in the middle, the Amsterdam City Girl and the personification of Freedom of Conscience give a Jewish priest with prayer role and a kneeling woman with tables of law the freedom to practice their religion. To the left of this a map of the temple, on the right a face on the outside. On both sides medallions with the names of regents of the synagogue, members of the construction committee and persons who performed ceremonies during the inauguration.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Interieur van de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, ca. 1695. Tempel der Joden in Amsteldam / Templo o Sinagoga de los Judias en Amsteldam (title on object)
images.description: View of the interior of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, around 1695. Possible during the annual commemoration of the inauguration that took place on 2 August 1675. In the middle, on the east-facing teba, the chazan. Above in the middle clouds with the Amsterdam city virgin and the personification of Judaism or Old Testament. Between them in a torarol with a decorative tower and the coat of arms of Amsterdam. Above that a banderole with the title in Dutch and Spanish.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: De voorhof en de vrouweningang van de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, ca. 1695. Het voorhof en ingang der vrouwen (title on object)
images.description: View of the forecourt and the women's entrance on the east side of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, around 1695. On the forecourt groups of women. At the top of the middle a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: De heilige ark (aron hakodesj of hechal) in de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, ca. 1695. De Kas der Wetboeken (title on object)
images.description: View of the holy ark (aron hakodesh or hechal) made of Brazilian jacaranda wood in the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, around 1695. For this cupboard, in which the torahs are kept, reading and talking Jewish men. At the top of the middle a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: De teba (bima) in de Portugese Synagoge te Amsterdam, ca. 1695. De predikstoel en binnen transen (title on object)
images.description: View of the teba (bima) made of Brazilian jacaranda wood in the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam, around 1695. On and around the teba reading and talking Jewish men. At the top of the middle a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Viering van Simchat Thora in de synagoge en een optocht ter ere van het feest. Synagogue des Juifs Portugais, à Amsterdam / Simcha Tora ou Ioye pour la Loy / Maniere de conduire les epoux de la Loy, chez eux (title on object)
images.description: Sheet with two representations of Jewish customs around the celebration of Simchat Torah or Joy of Law. Above: in the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam the cabinet where the scrolls are kept is opened. On the left side of the cupboard is a so-called bridegroom of the law with the scroll Beresiet (Genesis) and on the right a bridegroom of the law with the last scroll of the Torah: Dewariem (Deuteronomy). Below: the grooms of the law, the readers of the Torah, are accompanied in a procession with torches at the feast of Simchat Torah or Joy of Law. Below the illustrations an explanation in French.
images.creator: Bernard Picart

images.title: Vier verschillende kerken en synagogen te Amsterdam
images.description: Four numbered churches and synagogues in Amsterdam: Lutheran Church, New Lutheran Church, High German Synagogue, Portuguese Synagogue. Print marked left and right above: II. Part. 2. Book - Pag. 83.
images.creator: print maker: Anna Folkema

images.title: The arrival in Amsterdam of Lodewijk Napoleon on April 20, 1808
images.description: Festive arrival of Louis Napoleon as king of Holland in Amsterdam, April 20, 1808. Procession of two carriages with escort, many cheering spectators on the street. Viewed from the Nieuwe Amstelstraat. On the right the Portuguese-Jewish Synagogue (now Mr. Visserplein), on the right in front the Great Synagogue (Nieuwe Amstelstraat).
images.creator: draughtsman: Jan Anthonie Langendijk Dzn (signed by artist)

images.title: Hier hebt gij weer schoone gebouwen, In 't vermaarde Amsterdam gemaakt, / Om weeuw en wees te onderhouden, En de koopmanschap ook wordt bewaakt (title on object)
images.description: Sheet with 16 representations of important buildings in Amsterdam: orphanages, hospitals and trading houses. Underneath each image a caption. Numbered top right: 48.
images.creator: publisher: J. Ratelband and J. Bouwer (mentioned on object)

images.title: Interior of the Portuguese Synagogue in Amsterdam

Here is a separate text sheet with text in 3 columns in Dutch, Portuguese and French and 5 verses in Dutch, Portuguese, Hebrew, Latin and French.

images.title: Mikve Israel, building details
images.description: Left: Yellow brick sheath of a centrall and gallery support column; Above right: Capital of a central column; Center right: One of the 10 ceiling rosettes used for hanging a chandelier; Below right: (1732) latticed bannister in front of the landing leading to the attic
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro, Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Mikve Israel, building details
images.description: Left: Covered by clay shingles, facing sides of 2 (of the 3) roofs of the synagogue. Above right: 1 of the Synagogue's 3 attics. Center right: Detail of the tip of 1 of the 10 support hooks which serves to hand a chandelier from the ceiling. Below right: An open pair of "throughway" doors.
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Our Snow, Synagogue Mikve Israel-Emanuel, located at the corner of Kerkstraat and Colubusstraat in the heart of Punda, in Willemstad
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: The central portal on the Concessiestraat, now called Columbusstraat.
images.description: Note th wooden plaque attached to the outside lintel and the Hebrew words engraved in marble to the right and left of the arch
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Facing east, the candlelit interior of the synagogue
images.description: Note the open Heychal, the Tebah, and the Banca
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: The steps on the southern side of the tebah
images.description: Note: against the back of the tebah the two wooden columns supporting the gallery under the organ; center (in the tebah) the cloth-covered shulchan or Reader's desk, background: the northern women's gallery, foreground: the carpet of sand on the floor
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Mikve Israel, building details
images.description: Left: The main entrance into the sanctuary; Above right: The lintel above the main entrance; Center right: Details of the second word in the Hebrew text above the door; Below right: Key opening the sanctuary doors
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro, Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Ritual objects
images.description: Left: 1 of the 4 brass ornaments serving as rimonim standard on the balustrade of the tebah. Mounted, one of the two rimonim which decorate the torah scroll when it is lifted; Above right: The mahagony shulchan (reader's desk); Center: 2 of the 4 brass candlesticks on the balustrade of the tebah; Center right: Lecturn on the pulpit; Below right: 1 of the 4 silver knobs which decorate the corners of the Reader's desk.
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro, Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: The open heychal with its 17 ornamented torah scrolls
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Ritual objects
images.description: Left: 1 of the 4 brass candle-sticks on the balustrade; Above center: Silver door knobs and lock plate of the upper center door; Cneter: 1 of the 2 silver knobs of the upper side doors; Below center: Silver lock plate of the lower center door; Above right: The ten commandments, in silver letters inlaid on mahagony, decorating the top of the hechal; Below right: the brass Neyr Tamid with an 8-day candle burning inside its red glass holder.
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: The Banca of Mikve Israel-Emanuel with its 4 silver candlesticks dating to 1750
images.description: [Inset] Originally constructed to seat a 5-member Mahamad, 2 arms were removed in 1964 to allow seating of the 7 Parnassim of the merged congregation
images.creator: Frederick Fisher, Frank O'Farrel
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Synagogue chairs and benches
images.description: Above left: 1 of 6 "Chairs of Honor" near the entrance doors; Above center: one of the ground floor congregational benches; Above right: 1 of 2 Shamash chairs, located in the left and right of the banca; Below left: the Chacham's chair on the tebah; Below center: 1 of 4 chairs placed on the Heychal on Simchat Torah; Below right: "Chair of Elijah" used for circumcisions
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro, Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Synagogue lighting fixtures
images.description: Above left: 1 of 4 brass chandeliers; Above right: view of candlelit chandelier from below; Below left: 1 of 8 brass chandlesticks on the balustrade of the Heycha; and Tebah. background center: 1 of the 12 pillar sconces and 1 of 23 wall sconces; Below center: The 4 - 1750 silver candlesticks on the balustrade of the banca; Below right: The special 7-branched menorah used on Kol Nidre and weddings
images.creator: Rene D.L. Maduro, Frederick Fisher, Frank O'Farrel
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Open torah with embroidered green silk back cloth and gold yad with left-handed pointing finger
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Some of the sifre torah in the hechal
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Torah crowns
images.description: Left: gilded torah crown dating to 1760. Silver breast plate -1721; Above right: Silver torah crown - 1714; Below right: silver torah crowns -1714
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Rimonim
images.description: Above left: SIlver rimonim with the "sinlge shell" motif, gold bells and crown; Above right: Rimonim made of silver filigree with gold bells; Below left: Rimonim made of silver filigree with gold bells and gold crown; probably made in Curacao; Below right: Silver rimonim with the "double shell" motif, gold bells and gold crown.
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Ritual silver objects
images.description: Left: Silver Besamin box -1706; Above right: silver Kohanim tray and jug -1748; Center right: Silver bowl used to collect "tzedaka" during Purim; Below right: Silver tray used to smash the glass at the end of the wedding ceremony - circa 1728
images.creator: Frederick Fisher
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.title: Images depicting Mikve Israel Synagogue, 18th-19th c.
images.description: Above: Watercolor " The Island of Curacao - 1786"; Below left: "Curacao 1850", a postcard by W.M. Hoyer, 1934; Below right: "Willemstad the Waaigat", an early 19th c. litho by J.E. van Heemskerck van Beest. Note: the arrows added point to the location of Mikve Israel Synagogue

images.title: Collage of period documents relating to the building of our Snoa
images.description: July 26, 1730 contract with Henerik Schielach, master carpenter of Amsterdam; July 7, 1730 contract wih Jacobus de Wit of Amsterdam to purchase and ship the building materials; July 30, 1730 receipt for the purchase of 400 square feet along the city wall of Willemstad; Memorias Curiel: a journal written by the son of Ephraim Curiel, covering the periods of 1716-1739.
images.citation: Maduro, René, ed. 1982. Our “Snoa”, 5492-5742. Willemstad, Curaçao: Congregation Mikvé Isreal-Emmanuel Curaçao.

images.description: Reconstruction. Based on the research by Henk Zantkuijl and Hans van Agt.
images.creator: Timothy De Paepe
images.citation: De Paepe, Timothy, and Paul D. Meijer. 2014. “De Talmoed Tora-Synagoge (1639-1675): Een Reconstructie van de Directe Voorganger van de Nog Bestaande Portugese Synagoge in Amsterdam.” Jaarboek van Het Genootschap Amstelodamum, 47–67.

images.title: Isometric cross section of the Neve Salom synagogue (1612-1639)
images.description: Isometric cross section of the Neve Salom synagogue (1612-1639). Timothy De Paepe, 2015. It is a simplified, hypothetical reconstruction, without further investigation based on H.J Zantkuijl, 'Reconstruction of an early 17c century synagogue', Amstelodamum 57 (1970) 9, p. 199-207. On the outside, the synagogue appears to be an inconspicuous house, and the ground floor was divided into two residential units.
images.citation: De Paepe, Timothy, and Paul D. Meijer. 2014. “De Talmoed Tora-Synagoge (1639-1675): Een Reconstructie van de Directe Voorganger van de Nog Bestaande Portugese Synagoge in Amsterdam.” Jaarboek van Het Genootschap Amstelodamum, 47–67.

images.title: 1806 Plat of the Synagogue Site
images.description: “Note the Synagogue building and Burial Grounds as they are positioned today, and the buildings that are identified as Dwelling Houses were contiguous.  They housed the officers of the Synagogue - the Rabbi, Shamash (warden), Shoket (ritual slaughterer), and Banadeira (female keeper of the Mikvah)”. images.title: Beschrijving De Houtgracht
images.description: Description De Houtgracht, later Waterlooplein 27-65, after 1983 129-207, before the damping in 1882. On the far left, the entrance to the Houtkopersdwarsstraat. At Waterlooplein 207 the Mozes and Aäron Church. The numbers 61-65 were demolished in 1968. In the foreground the bridge between the Vlooienburgersteeg (later: Houtkopersdwarsstraat) and the Korte Houtstraat. Braakensiek has used a picture published by A. Jager for this drawing. Watercolor. Dimensions 286 x 331 mm. Document type: drawing. Fabricator Braakensiek, J.C. (Johan Coenraad, 1858-1940). Collection Collection Amsterdam City Archives: drawings and prints. Dating 1867 ca. t / m 1875 approx. Geographical name Houtkopersdwarsstraat; Waterlooplein Houtgracht

1895 Waterlooplein At the Waterlooplein is the city hall of Amsterdam. Around it is a market. There used to be two canals here. They were filled in 1882 and then the square was laid out. The name comes from the village of Waterloo in Belgium. There the French emperor Napoleon was defeated in 1815.

images.title: Reconstruction of the façade of the Talmud Torah synagogue
images.description: Reconstruction of the façade of the Talmud Torah synagogue. Timothy De Paepe, 2015. The stairs in the middle of the façade lead to the basement from where one could enter the synagogue on the first floor along spiral staircases. The gate on the right probably led to the stairs to the women's galleries.
images.creator: Timothy De Paepe
images.citation: De Paepe, Timothy, and Paul D. Meijer. 2014. “De Talmoed Tora-Synagoge (1639-1675): Een Reconstructie van de Directe Voorganger van de Nog Bestaande Portugese Synagoge in Amsterdam.” Jaarboek van Het Genootschap Amstelodamum, 47–67.

images.title: Reconstruction of the Talmud Tora synagogue from 1639 on the Houtgracht (Waterlooplein 33-37 / 38).
images.description: Facade, cross section, length section and floor plan. Scale 1: 400. With situation in 1876. The gallery sections with the women's places were probably accessible along separate external stairs. (Drawing Monument Protection).
images.citation: Agt, J. F. van. 1974. Synagogen in Amsterdam. ’s-Gravenhage : Staatsuitgeverij.

images.title: Reconstruction of the interior of the Talmud Torah synagogue
images.description: Reconstruction of the interior of the Talmud Torah synagogue. Timothy De Paepe, 2015. At the back right you can see the bench of the maiimad; in the center, in the corner, one of the two spiral staircases is visible that connect the basement, the ground floor and the gallery, with one of the 'cupboards' next to it.
images.creator: Timothy De Paepe
images.citation: De Paepe, Timothy, and Paul D. Meijer. 2014. “De Talmoed Tora-Synagoge (1639-1675): Een Reconstructie van de Directe Voorganger van de Nog Bestaande Portugese Synagoge in Amsterdam.” Jaarboek van Het Genootschap Amstelodamum, 47–67.

images.title: Synagogue on the Uilenburgerstraat (1765-66) before 1940. The iron windows with Star of David from 1858-59 were replaced in 1954 by windows with a rod division in 18th century style.
images.citation: Agt, J. F. van. 1974. Synagogen in Amsterdam. ’s-Gravenhage : Staatsuitgeverij.

images.title: Synagogue on the Uilenburgerstraat (1765-66), "Fourth Jews church or synagogue in the Agter Street in a corridor in 1768, drawing Gerrit van Lingen in his copy of the history of Amsterdam by J. Wagenaar.
images.citation: Agt, J. F. van. 1974. Synagogen in Amsterdam. ’s-Gravenhage : Staatsuitgeverij.

images.title: Ground floor and main room plan, and cross section of the synagogue on Uilenburgerstraat. Partial reconstruction of the situation around 1940
images.citation: Agt, J. F. van. 1974. Synagogen in Amsterdam. ’s-Gravenhage : Staatsuitgeverij.

images.title: Interior of the synagogue on the Uilenburgerstraat before 1940. Arke, bima, benches and candlesticks from the construction period and gas crowns from 1859. All this was lost in the Second World War. (From: Program of the solemn religious service commemorating the centennial of the synagogue on Uilenburgerstraat, 1916)
images.citation: Agt, J. F. van. 1974. Synagogen in Amsterdam. ’s-Gravenhage : Staatsuitgeverij.
